text: Thirty First Sunday in Ordinary Time October 30 2022 As a reminder Daylight Savings Time ends next Sunday November 6th Don't forget to turn your clocks back one hour next Sunday This weekend October 29th 30th the Church celebrates the Thirty first Sunday in Ordinary Time We are once again entering into the last month of the liturgical year In four weeks we will celebrate the end of the year with the Solemnity of Jesus Christ King of the Universe The new liturgical year will begin the following week Nov 26th 27th as we enter into Advent Our readings throughout these remaining weekends begin to focus on the themes of repentance reparation and the final judgment We are urged not only to repent while we still have time to do so but also to right the wrongs we have done to others that is to make reparation for our actions These themes will continue for the remainder of the liturgical year using its coming end to remind us of our own mortality Though these themes may seem overwhelming they are not meant to be so Instead they are meant to remind us of a simple truth If we walk with Christ He will lead us safely to the end of our earthly pilgrimage and guide us to the heavenly kingdom Just as the year begins and ends with Christ so too must our lives Only in this do we realize that it is not for this world that we live Instead our hearts long for where our true treasure is Or in the words of St Augustine of Hippo You have made us for yourself Lord and our heart is restless until it rests in you Holy Day of Obligation Solemnity of All Saints As a reminder this Tuesday November 1st is a Holy Day of Obligation as we celebrate the Solemnity of All Saints Masses for the Holy Day will be offered on Monay Oct 31st at 7:00PM and Tuesday Nov 1st at 7:00AM Noon and 6:00PM Following the 6:00PM Mass on Tuesday Nov 1st join us for our annual All Saints Day Potluck and Party in the Parish Social Hall and Gym Reminder You are invited to dress up as your favorite Saint and join in the procession at the beginning of the 6:00PM Mass Please arrive by 5:50PM to join the procession as the Saints go marching in The following day Wednesday November 2nd marks the Commemoration of All Souls or All Souls Day Though this day is not a holy day it is an important day nonetheless as we remember and pray for all those who have died To emphasize the importance of this day the Church encourages priests to offer three Masses on this day With this allowance we will offer Masses for All Souls Day on Wed Nov 2nd at 8:00AM Noon and 6:00PM Note The 6:00PM All Souls Day Mass will be offered at St Joseph Catholic Cemetery on IN 124 Please bring your own chair Throughout the month of November you will also notice votive candles surrounding the statues of the Blessed Mother and St Joseph Each votive candle has listed serving as a reminder of our dearly departed loved ones May they serve as a constant reminder to lift all those who have died to the Lord in and through our prayers that they might enter into the glory of the Kingdom New Parish Website special Thank You to parishioner Dan Lautzenheiser for his work on our new parish website www.stjosephchurchbluffton.org The new design is both more user friendly and will allow us to more easily keep the website up to date with upcoming events and activities If you haven't yet had a chance to do so make sure to check it out Bible Study Jesus and the Covenant special Thank You to those who joined us for our bible study session An Introduction to Typology Jesus as the New Adam Our next session Jesus and the Covenant will look at the fulfillment of the biblical covenants in Jesus Christ and will be on Thursday November 10th at 7:00PM in the Parish Social Hall Each session is independent meaning that you don't have to worry about falling behind if you miss a session MASS INTENTIONS Saturday October 29 8:00am Special Intention 400 4:45pm Confession 4:35pm Rosary 5:00pm Rick
